Players who play poorly and repeatedly die do not fall under this category, only those who have the intent to feed the opposing team. In most cases you will need written proof that the player is intentionally feeding.

In this instance, the player will usually stay in the base, refusing to help, and only move when they are in danger of being marked AFK and getting kicked. If the player simply goes AFK and can be kicked, they are not avoiding AFK detection.

Items or abilities such as Tablet of Command, Stormspirit, or Flux's "Magnetic Surge" that are constantly used on a teammate or yourself to ruin one's experience. Other instances can include a Behemoth constantly blocking players with Fissure, Succubus using Mesmerize on you, or a Blood Hunter using his silence ability on you.
Sending countless couriers to their death or wasting countless wards.
Buying all the wards in the game and placing them in the base, or selling all items and buying couriers to feed to the enemy would be examples of this.
Destroying one's items out of spite.
The destruction of a player's items with intent to upset others. Destroying items before disconnecting to spite your team is an example of this.
Attacking a tower without any creeps by it.
Backdooring is not against the code of conduct and is not a reportable action. It is a viable strategy and can be easily countered with a homecoming stone.
Leaving in the middle of games, also known as "Rage Quitting".
Simply leaving the game and not breaking any other rules does not warrant a suspension. The player already gains leave percentage. If he has broken a rule, please report him for that instead.
Not warding, dying a lot, and using skills ineffectively.
Being unskilled or bad is not a reportable offense. Try to teach them how to play better instead.
Not being an asset in team fights, such as not using their skill when they could have.
Only report the player if he is intentionally avoiding team fights in order to force a loss.
Impersonation of Frostburn or any volunteer position, including Moderators and Game Masters.
In this case, if a player claims to be a staff member or a Game Master and says he is going to suspend you, this would be a reportable offense.
Any offense that does not fit into one of the other categories.

AFK Detection is designed to allow allied players to remove an offender who has decided to quit playing the game. When kicked, this provides the remaining team members with a gold bonus and items, allowing them to better continue their game.

Player "1337honn3r" reports: "Offender went to the pool at level 4 and stayed there until the end of the game." This report was marked innocent because the offender sat in the well and did not move or cast spells. An AFK flag was raised, but he was never kicked.

Ability and/or Item Abuse occurs when players attempt to disrupt teammates by using specific items or abilities. "No-Help" can be toggled by clicking the green circle next to their hero portrait, but is still a reportable offense if used to effect the outcome of the game.

Player "1337honn3r" reports: "While trying to escape, my ally used a tablet of command on me, and I accidentally got stuck in trees." This report was deemed innocent because the reported player was attempting to use his item for its intended purpose.

Player allows the courier to be killed on accident and will not buy a new one.
Player buys all the wards, but places them appropriately
Player purchases items that may not be beneficial, but can't be lost when dropped

If a player is mass purchasing items and/or couriers, they often hinder the team. Such examples of this include, but are not limited to: purchasing all the wards and placing them in base, buying a Bound Eye then sacrificing it to the other team, or buying multiple couriers and sending them to die.

Player "1337honn3r" reports: "Our ally bought wards but placed it so it couldn't see the rune spawn." This report was deemed innocent because the wards were placed to give vision of enemy heroes, despite the lack of knowledge the player had of warding spots.

Item Destruction can be reported when a player (and more often an ally) destroys items that could benefit you or the team. A common example is a player that destroys their own items before disconnecting, in order to leave the allied teammembers without any sort of compensation.

During Flame Consumption, place yourself in harm's way to heal more. Cauterize will also heal you.
Use Fire Shield to remove debuffs and stuns from allies.
Avoid damaging Accursed when he uses Flame Consumption.
Back away from targets with Fire Shield before damaging them if possible.
Rush is a great initiation and retreat tool, saving enough mana to use this if needed is never a bad idea.
Items such as Power Supply and Blood Chalice may be activated to grant Adrenaline an extra ability use in a time of need.
When you have many Stacks of Dread built up on you, letting the debuff fall off before re-engaging could save you from a quick death.
Stormspirit is a powerful tool to stop Adrenaline's ultimate combo from killing yourself or an ally.

Pressing Deja Vu once gives Aluna a speed burst which can help to get away. Pressing it again can confuse enemies as to where you really are. The third time teleports you back to your image and disjoints any incoming projectiles.
Remember that you can stop Power Throw mid cast if it looks like you won't hit it. Order Stop is bound to "s" by default.
Move erratically if you are expecting a charged Power Throw.
Avoid standing next to the last creep in your wave to prevent Emerald Lighting from stunning you.
The Burning Ember can keep you in your lane or allow you to return to a fight without having to return to the fountain, be sure to make good use of it.
Fire Surge is an excellent harass and poke tool. Using this ability in conjunction with a Blood Chalice, can provide a constant stream of damage.
Magic Immunity is key in facing Apex. Make sure to get a shrunken head as soon as possible.
Apex has a low mana pool and a lot of spells to cast. Try a nullfire or heroes that have mana draining, burning abilities.
Path of Destruction allows you to move through terrain; use this to your advantage.
Consider not casting spells when you are already low on hit points.
Path of Destruction has a set range of 600. Move perpendicularly to avoid it.
Draining Amun-Ra's mana can reduce the effect of Pyroclasmic Rebirth after he dies.
Use Void Rip to swap positions with an unknowing enemy. Stun him to ensure an escape.
Aurora can be used to scout areas covered by fog of war.
Avoid Andromeda's Void Rip by staying behind allies or buying a Nullstone.
Andromeda is one of the most effective support gankers. Be aware of where she is on the map.
Try to activate Harden Carapace before you start taking damage. Support heroes and casters make easy prey for your Spider Sting.
Harden Carapace can be saved to clear a specific debuffs such as Keeper of the Forest's Root.
Aracha has no interrupting ability. Carry a Homecoming Stone and teleport out if you are in trouble.
The Spider Sting's Spiderling can be killed if attacked four times. It can be killed easily with help from a teammate.
Try to anticipate enemy attacks and turn Armadon's back to them. By doing this Armordillo will cause more Spine Bursts to fire off and decrease incoming damage!
Try to save mana to use in a sustained battle where you can get multiple Spine Bursts off in a row on enemies.
Keep track of Spine Burst stacks and back off if they are getting too high. Armadon deals the most damage in sustained battles.
Armadon has no interrupting ability. Carry a Homecoming Stone and teleport out if you are in trouble.
Running over corpses replenishes Balphagore's health. Although this is not much, it can often make the difference in a fight.
Regurgitate can be used simply to heal and get charges for Corpse Conversion.
Don't forget that Balphagore's minions do a lot of damage over time while putting a stacking slow on someone each time they hit.
Items such as Shieldbreaker and Hellflower are great ways to help kill enemy tank heroes like Balphagore.
Try to use Fissure to stun and block off paths from assailants.
A clumped group of enemies makes easy prey for Shockwave. Buy a Portal Key to help you position yourself optimally.
When Shockwave is available, it is imperative to keep your team scattered. A clumped team will die almost instantly against a Behemoth.
Be aware of Behemoth's positioning and where he can Fissure to block you.
Frenzy can be used for a movespeed buff to help get away from enemies. Using Fireball and Flaming Hammer can also slow enemies down.
Time your Fireball to cast immediately after Flaming Hammer hits your target to maximize magic damage.
Flaming Hammer lowers your magic armor, picking up some extra magic armor from Mystic Vestments or going for Shrunken Head can help prevent this.
Nullstone is an effective counter to heroes with powerful single target spells such as Blacksmith.
If being pursued, cast Hemorrhage to force them to take damage. If they lose too much health, you will gain movement speed from Blood Sense.
Blood Crazy is one of the best silences in the game, but be careful about casting it on enemy heroes with high attack damage.
Don't move while afflicted with Hemorrhage! Blood Hunter lacks an interrupt, so carry a Homecoming Stone and teleport out if necessary.
Be careful not to get too low on hit points while killing neutral creeps against a team with Blood Hunter.
Use Bombardment to slow assailants. Sticky Bomb can also be used as a deterrent.
Heroes stop moving when they attack. Use this period as an opportunity to drop a Sticky Bomb on them.
Stay away from allies and get in a safe position if you have Sticky Bomb on you.
Air Strike has global range, so be attentive and pick unusual paths to retreat when you're low on hit points.
Cast Shell Surf then Take Cover to become invulnerable before teleporting away.
A clumped group of enemies makes easy prey for Song of the Sea and Kelp Field. A Portal Key can help catch enemies clumped or help you escape after a Take Cover.
Pay attention to where Bubbles is Shell Surfing. Not doing so often leads to him porting to it afterwards to hit players with Song of the Sea and Kelp Field.
It's important to stay scattered to avoid Song of the Sea and Kelp Field when you anticipate a team fight against Bubbles.
Use your W and E keys to move your orbs in and out, allowing you to deal damage to enemies that are far away without putting yourself at risk!
Remeber that Funeral Pyre's wall is not instantly set up. It takes time to create the circle, so plan ahead!
Move away from the bouncing Rain of Fire, as you will get pulled back into it every time you are hit again!
If you are caught inside of the Funeral Pyre's wall, turn and fight! You can't run through it!
A Thousand Cuts is a great zoning tool that procs Enlightenment and clears creep waves. Be sure to use this often and have high Mana sustain!
Late-game, save your Disarm on Crippling Puncture for enemy autoattack carries. It will ruin their day!
A Thousand Cuts is relatively slow-moving and has high mana upkeep for Qi. Dodge this as best you can, and don't let Qi get the upper hand in the early game!
Ancestral Assault has a small delay before it triggers. Be alert to dodge the heavy burst damage from it!
Quickly cast Rocket Barrage on assailants to mini-stun and slow them down. If they come too close, Tar Toss to slow them further.
If you're having trouble hitting Rocket Barrage, try saving it for when the enemy is closer, mid attack animation, or is immobilized.
Stay out of Sawblade Showdown! If hit by Tar Toss, try to move erratically to dodge an incoming Rocket Barrage.
Chipper does large amounts of magic damage, picking up some extra magic armor from Mystic Vestments or going for Shrunken Head can help prevent this.
Time Leap should either be used as initiation, leading into Chronofield, or saved as an escape.
Position Chronofield so that you catch enemies on the close edge in order to allow friendly melee units to help attack them.
Kill Chronos early and often to prevent him from farming. A late game Chronos should be focused relentlessly.
It's important to stay scattered to avoid Chronofield when you anticipate a team fight against Chronos.
Cast Corrupted Conduit on an assailant to drain his damage. Use your superior movement speed to escape, or simply turn on him for a kill once you've drained his damage.
Corrupted Disciple does well in sustained battles where he can stack up Corrupted Conduit and keep Overload hitting enemies. Protective items can help battles become prolonged.
Corrupted Conduit lowers your damage while increasing Corrupted Disciple's and giving him vision of the target! Avoid this by running 700 or more units away from Corrupted.
Keep track of how long Corrupted Disciple has had Corrupted Conduit on. Corrupted Disciple can do devastating damage if he has a high stack of Corrupted Conduit.
The damage reduction from Hook'em only applies if enemies hit Cthulhuphant in the front. Trample can also be used as a way to escape from enemies.
Trample through creeps to help ensure a stun and deal extra damage.
Trample pushes creeps in front of Cthulhuphant dealing extra damage and stunning; avoiding creeps between Cthulhuphant and you can often allow you to dodge the trample completely.
Deal damage from behind to avoid Cthulhuphant's Hook'em shield.
Vampiric Flight and Consume can be used to regain hit points quickly. Fighting is sometimes the solution to surviving!
Queue up spells while using Vampiric Flight. Queuing can be done by holding "Shift" by default.
Buy Magic Armor to mitigate Dampeer's spell damage.
Ganking Dampeer will shut down his ganking potential for a couple of minutes while he has to regain Essences to be effective.
Cast Cover of Darkness to blind enemies, then use Charging Strikes to escape.
Taint Soul can be used as an effective last hitting tool when getting in melee range isn't an option.
Avoid Dark Lady when she has Dark Blades activated. She is much more vulnerable without them!
Kill Dark Lady early and often to prevent her from farming. A late game Dark Lady should be focused relentlessly.
Activate Clearcutting and head straight for the trees when in trouble. Your opponents will lose sight of you.
Rotten Grasp can make Willowmaker do extra damage by reducing enemy armor.
Buy copious amounts of armor to prevent Willowmaker from blasting you away.
Vision from Wards of Sight and good movement speed can be the best way to avoid a Rotten Grasp and Willowmaker combo completely.

Activate Unholy Expulsion and attack a single target to quickly bring him down. Buy protective items, as your primary source of damage output comes from using Unholy Expulsion and keeping yourself alive!
Wave of Death has a short cooldown and can be cast at considerable range affecting multiple enemies at once. Position and mobility are key for lining up your enemies.
Never take on Defiler one-on-one when she has Unholy Expulsion activated. Be mindful of your health when fighting her; when the ghosts start swooping in, you're going to be in trouble.
Wave of Death has a very long range. Move perpendicularly to avoid it.
Cast Unbreakable on yourself when you're at low health. Any instance of lethal damage will heal you instead!
Try to kite enemy heroes into your friendly creep wave and then cast Healing Wave for a devastating effect.
Lethal damage will heal Demented Shaman when he has Unbreakable activated. A small amount of armor will go a long way to mitigating the effects of Storm Cloud!
Avoid standing in the enemy creep wave to prevent taking up to 700 physical damage from a Healing Wave.

Intermittently turn Decay on and off to slow and damage assailants. If they lack an interrupt, Devour one of them to cause a large health swing before continuing to escape or turning on them for a kill.
Buying magic armor such as Mystic Vestments or Shaman's Headdress will help you take less damage from your own Decay.
Interrupt Devourer as soon as he begins to Devour.
Move erratically and stay behind allied creeps to avoid being grabbed by Guttling Hook.
You can use abilities and items while moving with Ludicrous Speed.
Keep a high mana pool to ensure you can get into and out of a fight with Ludicrous Speed when needed.
Make good use of crowd control when fighting Dr. Repulsor. He doesn't have much burst damage, but his sustained damage and mobility can get out of control if you don't kill him early.
Hellflower and other silencing effects are very effective at shutting down Doctor Repulsor.
Drink passively boosts your other abilities as long as charges are in reserve. Activating Drink will drain your reserve charges and replenish some life.
Use Stagger to disjoint incoming spells and attacks when in trouble.
Avoid casting targeted spells on Drunken Master while Untouchable is activated.
Drunken Master deals a lot of physical damage, so buying armor will help to mitigate his usefulness.
Try using Onslaught on towers and structures when enemy creep waves are nearby to quickly damage them.
You can control the direction and extend the range of Death Grip by reactivating the ability while channelling.
Make sure to take out enemy gravestones to stop Deadlift from reviving them.
Be careful when next to a large creep wave, Onslaught causes all nearby units to instantly aggro a target outputting high physical damage rapidly.
When escaping, activate Electric Shield as often as possible to mitigate incoming damage. Use Cleansing Shock on yourself to boost your own speed.
Try to use Static Grip after the enemy team has used it's disable spells or on the hero with the last unused disable in order to get a long-duration Static Grip.
Stay close to an allied disabler to prevent long-duration Static Grips.
Electrician is highly reliant on Electric Shield to deal damage, so reduce his mana by attacking him while it's up or burning his mana.
Emerald Warden has very high sustained damage. Try to stay hidden behind allies and unleash your spells from a safe distance.
Set Overgrowth's near your tower to punish overaggressive enemies or use them for vision to avoid ganks.
Hunter's Command has huge range and does not require sight. Retreat early to avoid an untimely death.
Overgrowths can be destroyed with 1-2 attacks if you get trapped in them.
A well-placed Illusory Veil can be the difference between life or death. You can also dodge incoming damage by jumping into an ally with As One.
If Essence link is about to expire anyway, break it by moving away for the extra stun.
Quickly focus down Empath before she's able to enter an ally with As One. If she successfully combines, kill her target to cause her to pop out. Empath is very vulnerable alone.
Break Essence Link early or not at all to avoid taking both the damage and the stun.
Try to land The Keg on yourself and pursuing enemies to stun them while building distance. Unleashing Energy Field can slow surrounding enemies to a crawl.
Knock back targets trying to run out of Energy Field with The Keg.
Attack the Engineer's gadgets to prevent them from dealing too much damage. Be wary of being led into Spider Mine traps.
Be aware of Engineer's mana and position to get an idea when and where he's placing Spider Mines.
Use Burning Shadows to stun assailants. While using Reflection, be mindful of enemies that are carrying stealth detection.
Use the treewalking of Reflection to surprise enemies that have stealth detection.
Keep good map awareness and buy Ward of Revelations to prevent Fayde from taking you by surprise.
Buy hit point items such as Fortified Bracers and magic armor such as Mystic Vestments to keep Fayde from killing you with her burst magic damage.
Flint Beastwood is best played in the back lines of a fight dealing damage from afar while his teammates occupy the enemy team.
Explosive Flare does damage to buildings and can be used to finish off towers enemies are trying to deny.
Flint Beastwood does very good damage from a long distance, but has little ways to escape if you get close to him.
Look to gank Flint Beastwood early and often. He is an easy target without an escape and he scales very well into late game if allowed to farm.
Activate Discharge while in purple mode to push all enemies away. Building strength on Flux not only increases his survivability, but increases the damage of Magnetic Surge.
Discharge can be used to reveal stealthed enemy heroes that would otherwise get away.
A Nullstone will protect you from a global Discharge.
Scatter from your teammates fast after a Discharge because it's usually followed up by many area of effect spells.
When escaping, predict your opponents' movements with Crippling Volley.
Save up the Call of the Damned skeletal minions for when you can push a tower or get into a fight. Click the ability to start stacking the minions and click it again to unleash them.
Piercing Arrows is cast from an illusion, but it can still be interrupted by a stun or silence.
Move erratically when you expect a Crippling Volley.
Cast Grapple on an ally to move both him and yourself out of harm's way.
Grapple can be used to hook in a hero or push both of you forward depending on how far you cast it.
A Nullstone will protect you from Gauntlet Blast. Gauntlet's damage output is all magic damage, so buy magic armor to mitigate its effects.
Be aware of Gauntlet's positioning to avoid being hooked or pushed into his tower range.
Use Dig to travel through unpathable terrain like cliffs and trees. Both Quicksand and Crystal Field can not only be placed on top of enemies, but in front of them as a deterrent.
You can cast spells while traveling underground with Dig.
When Crystal Field is placed, quickly move out of the way before it blows.
The pulsing damage from Earth's Grasp can be avoided if you can move fast enough. Marchers will help keep you ahead of them.
Use Ice Imprisonment to shut down an assailant. You can also cast Ice Imprisonment on yourself to mitigate damage for the duration, then cast Glacial Downpour to slow and damage nearby enemies.
Use Tundra Blast as Ice Imprisonment fades to avoid overlapping your disabling effects.
Glacial Downpour is one of the most damaging spells in the game. Quickly interrupt him if he channels it.
You can still cast spells while under the effect of Ice Imprisonment.
Try to position Pitfall to predict your opponent's movements.
Positioning is important for maximizing the number of enemies hit by Flagellation. An Assassin Shroud can help you position as well as give a damage boost to the Flagellation attack.
Move perpendicular to Gladiator to avoid being caught in Flagellation's radius.
Gladiator's spells have a long delay, so move erratically to avoid them.
Recluse is useful as a ward spotting tool. If Goldenveil loses his regeneration and no enemy is visible, they may have planted a ward nearby.
Ganking targets with more tokens not only causes Greedgutter to deal more damage, but also yields the highest gold reward for Goldenveil and his team.
Goldenveil is squishy and must be in melee range to perform his combo. Use this opportuity to burst him down before he can escape back into the trees.
Destroying trees not only limits the places Goldenveil can hide, but also stuns and reveals him if you destroy the tree he is perched on.
Save Hammer Throw for initiating, killing, and escaping. Proper use of the ability will determine how a team fight proceeds.
Buying a Portal Key will help you initiate fights without time for enemies to spread away from your area of effect stun.
Move away from allies when Hammerstorm performs a Hammer Throw. Crowd control is very powerful when trying to avoid the boosted autoattacks during his Brute Strength.
Buying and using a Void Talisman can be very effective at keeping yourself alive if a Hammerstorm is beating on you with Brute Strength.
Summon Malphas should generally be saved to initiate. However, its wide stun is great as an escape tool.
Remember that Malphas deals area of effect magic damage and bonus damage to buildings.
The stun and damage from Summon Malphas are unavoidable. However, Malphas can be instantly destroyed with Nullfire Blade.
Buy magic armor to offset the reduction from Demonic Touch.
Transfusion is best used to save an ally, but can also be used as a clutch escape in dire situations.
The lower your health is, the more you heal from Life Leech. Don't be afraid to stay and fight!
If Transfusion is making enemy heroes too tanky, use the opportunity to kill Ichor first, destroying the link and their increased defenses.
Bloodrush greatly reduces your team's auto-attack potential; try bursting him down with magic if he activates it.
By casting Protective Charm and Sol's Blessing, you will become effectively invulnerable for the duration.
A timely Inner Light can quickly swing a fight in your favor.
Buy a Nullfire Blade or use a dispel ability to remove Jeraziah's powerful buffs.
Try to take out Jeraziah first before he can get off Sol's Blessing or scare him into using it early and re-engage after it fades.
Parade of Power can hit twice if you send it through someone and then use the ability again!
Using your abilities offensively against enemy heroes will quickly build up and proc Conscription.
When you see a Parade of Power coming, move quickly! The ability is easy to dodge, but punishing if it hits you!
Getting close to King Klout can get you in trouble when he casts Bluster. Be careful when next to him!
Save Nature's Veil for either initiation or escape. If in trouble, do not hesitate to cast Root and immobilize enemies in a wide area.
If the enemy team has stealth detection, buying a Portal Key can get you in position to catch them with Root.
Casting Shrunken Head, Nullfire Blade, Geometer's Bane, or another magic immunity or dispel will instantly remove Root. Buy stealth detection to prevent him from ambushing your team.
Items such as Shieldbreaker and Hellflower are great ways to help kill enemy tank heroes like Keeper of the Forest. Nullfire Blade can also help by removing his Nature's Veil.
Waylay can be used in many ways. From catching players off guard to wiping out creep waves for a quick farm and push.
If you are taking a lot of damage during the laning phase try keeping Balance of Power set to Defense so you can increase your base armor making enemies have a harder time harrassing you out of lane.
Remember you can use your ultimate to call out a tower to force it to attack you. When doing this with your Steel Resolve you can tank a tower for your creeps and take very little damage.
Putting an early point in steel resolve will go a long way in putting you ahead in any 1 versus 1 fight.
Use Tsunami Charge to escape from enemies. Torrent can also be used to slow assailants.
Release the Kraken has a 1 second delay. Predict where your enemies will run to catch them in it.
Don't sandwich yourself between Kraken and a wall or tree. When he Releases the Kraken, furiously click away from the center of the beast. If you touch the center, you will be stunned.
Tablet of Command is great way to save yourself or a teammate from Release the Kraken.
Buy a Portal Key! It's essential for initiating and escaping.
Right clicking on an enemy hero will get enemy creeps to attack you and activate Whirling Blade.
Stay a safe distance from allies to avoid a powerful Taunt. Keep your health high to avoid being Decapitated.
Don't go near friendly creeps when a Legionnaire is trying to attack you. Friendly creeps will only cause Legionnaire to whirl more often, hastening your death.
When using Stalk to harass, always time it so that you are in a safe position when it expires. Barrel Roll is a great tool for slowing multiple assailants drastically.
A well-timed Barrel Roll can be used to dodge spells while rolling.
Buy stealth detection to prevent Madman from sneaking away with Stalk. His viability decreases dramatically when he loses the element of surprise.
Stalk will do damage and make a sound as it passes through each enemy unit which allows you to have an idea where Madman is despite being invisible.

Pick your targets wisely. Use Flash only when you can be assured to survive. Your quick movespeed allows you to chase enemies down without the need for Flash, so save it whenever possible for a quick escape. Flash can also be used to hide behind unpathable terrain, such as cliffs and trees.
An early Helm of the Black Legion can be a great way to boost your low hit points and survive the early game.
Focus Magebane early to prevent him from farming. Late game, purchase a Nullstone to prevent his Mana Rift from instantly killing you when you are depleted of mana.
If a hero on your team is missing a significant amount of mana, scatter away from him before Mana Rift is cast.
A well-timed Lava Surge can allow you to dodge projectiles and travel through cliffs.
Use Steam Bath to quickly hide from sight, then travel in an unpredictable direction to escape. It also disjoints projectiles aimed at you.
Interrupt Magmus before he can channel Eruption. Spread your team out to avoid being caught in Lava Surge.
Buy stealth detection to prevent Magmus from getting away with Steam Bath.
Send your Sword Throw in one direction, then travel in another direction to force assailants to split up.
Buy a Shrunken Head to keep yourself from being stunned while you heal by attacking with Life Essence when focused.
When Maliken uses Sword Throw, follow the sword to preempt his teleport.
Maliken must be focused down or he may heal back up with Life Essence and the increased attack speed from Hellbourne Zeal.

Guardian Angel will lower your life if the target you placed it on is taking damage. Decide whether or not to use it before or after using Hand in Hand, as it can be used to save a low health ally if you are full health, or save you if you are low health.
Use Retribution after the enemy heroes cast their spells on you. Keep low hit points if you want to try to gank with Martyr.
Martyr's Retribution deals more damage the less health he has. Be prepared to deal with this damage if you decide to focus him, or make sure that he doesn't get a chance to cast it before he dies.
Martyr's Hand in Hand is a channeled ability. You should interrupt it to prevent him from healing.
Use Master's Call in its appropriate form to get out of trouble.
Keep map and team awareness because Master's Call has global range and the ability to save a teammate across the map.
Focus down Master of Arms quickly. He has very high damage output but typically very low health.
Don't stand in the Acid Bomb.
Use Golden Salvo and Lion's Pride as the primary components of your combo. Save Elemental Warp to escape or get the final hit.
Elemental Warp applies Reagent also at your starting location, so use Golden Salvo after Elemental Warping away as a secondary combo.
Avoid being hit by two of Midas' spells in a short window. Move erratically to dodge his skill shots.
Midas does primarily magic damage. Buy magic armor such as Mystic Vestments to help you survive his spells.
Your potential isn't limited to the illusions created by Schism; Geometer's Bane and Illusion runes can give you a power spike when your ultimate is down.
Wall of Mirrors can be used as a pseudo-escape in case of emergencies by targeting an enemy and running through your own walls.
Xemplar's illusions are his main source of damage, so destroy them with an Arcane Bomb or some AOE spells as quickly as possible.
Silencing Xemplar or depleting his mana will cause him to lose his main forms of burst damage and initiation.
Use Ephemeral Forge to get yourself in a good position to use your abilities, leaving yourself out of harm's way.
Cast Shards of Harkon on yourself or an ally right before entering your Arcane Overload! The Shards will stun when you exit the ability.
Kill the Illusion created by Ephemeral Forge quickly. It takes 250% bonus damage and gives you gold and experience when you kill it!
Remember if you have Mana Sunder cast on you, you lose all of your Mana again if you use an ability for its duration. Wait until it's over to combo spells together!
Cast Chrysalis when you're being focused. Cast Cleansing Wind before you emerge to give yourself a big boost of speed and remove any debuffs.
Keep back in team fights so you don't get focused down before you can use your reactive spells to save your team.
Because Monarch can remove disables from allies, focusing her first will prevent her from unleashing her reactive spells.
Switch targets from someone with Chrysalis unless you can burst it down to finish the target off.

Illusive Dash and Heavenly Vault allow you to travel great distances in a short amount of time. Casting Heavenly Vault on a Thousand Jin Slam will propel you across terrain, including cliffs and trees.
Using Heavenly Vault on buildings will propel you farther.
Prevent Monkey King from entering Heavenly Vault distance, as it is the most common start to his combo. Stay out of the second Thousand Jin Slam explosion.
Buy armor and hit point items to keep Monkey King from killing you with his combo.
Lead assailants into secluded areas so you can kill them with Moon Finale. Use the mini-stun from Moon Beam to facilitate chasing.
Play carefully while you don't have Moon Finale available. Enemies will be looking to kill you because of your low hit points and lack of escape.
Moon Finale does a huge amount of damage to individual targets, so stay close to allied units and heroes to distribute its power.
Look to gank Moon Queen early and often. She is an easy target without an escape and she scales very well into late game if allowed to farm.
Cast Matraxe to shield yourself from incoming damage. It will also prevent a Portal Key from going on cooldown!
Buy a Portal Key to get in a good position for devastating Quake stuns on grouped enemies.
Attack Moraxus when Matraxe is activated to prevent it from building up damage.
Move erratically to avoid More Axes.

Save Waveform for escapes. The bonus health from Forced Evolution can help you tank damage as you escape. After you've created some distance, Magic Carp can force an assailant to stop momentarily or be stunned.
Combo Weed Field onto a target as it's about to get hit by Magic Carp to ensure it hits.
Always stop right as Magic Carp is about to impact. Tight control of your hero will allow you to ignore its stun and dodge Weed Field simultaneously.
If you find Myrmidon is dealing too much damage while in Forced Evolution, buy magic armor to mitigate its damage.
Pounce may be cast on allies in order to get you out of a tight situation. It is also best to fight an enemy who is under your Smoke Bomb, as he will be extremely hindered if he tries to fight back.
A Nullfire Blade can be used to keep your target in your Smoke Bomb or to dispel Dust of Revelation from yourself.
Night Hound is permanently stealthed after he learns Invisibility. Buy stealth detection to avoid being ambushed.
Night Hound deals bonus damage with Backstab if he attacks from behind. Try to avoid running from him whenever possible.
Ballistic can be activated while moving, use this ability to kite your enemies and make you a harder target to hit.
Try to save Runaround for when you get heavily engaged upon as it can allow for enough time to escape or win a fight.
Divide & Conquer grants Ballistic additional damage the further you are away from Nitro, try to stay close to her when combating Nitro.
HEAT Rounds require 3 stacks before it does damage, try to let stacks expire before reengaging Nitro.

Nomad has a variety of tools to assist an escape. Use a mixture of Sandstorm and Mirage Strike to keep yourself invisible. A well-timed Edge Counter can also allow you to dodge potentially lethal damage while stunning its inflictor.
Finishing off an enemy will reset Mirage Strike's cooldown.
Buy armor to offset Nomad's powerful True and Mirage Strikes. Try to fake attacks and spellcasts to cause him to waste Edge Counter.
Buy stealth detection to prevent Nomad from sneaking away with Mirage Strike and Sandstorm.
Use Volatile Pod and Grace of the Nymph to keep yourself and allies at full health and mana. Use Teleport to escape when surrounded if your opponents do not have an interrupt.
Good use of Wards of Sight will allow you to use Teleport to set up ganks safely.
Keep good map awareness to prevent being ambushed by Nymphora and her allies using Teleport.
Take Nymphora out quickly to prevent her from keeping allies refueled with Volatile Pod and Grace of the Nymph.
Try to micromanage your Commanded units to block assailants as you escape. Activate Ophelia's Touch to heal yourself when in trouble.
Creeps have activated abilities you should try to micromanage. For example, Minotaurs can stun around themselves with Body Slam and Skeleton Kings can immobilize with The King's Grip.
Focus Ophelia first to prevent her support spells from being unleashed.
Wiping out Ophelia's minions with area of effect spells can set back her ganking ability for a couple of minutes.

Cannon Ball can launch you over unpathable terrain like cliffs and trees. If facing a lone assailant, casting Flick, then Face Smash, and following up with your other abilities can make quick work of him before he has a chance to react.
Pandamonium can be mana limited and items like Nullstone or Blood Chalice can help him cast all his spells.
Buy a Nullstone to prevent Face Smash. A Void Talisman will allow you to dodge all of Pandamonium's abilities for the duration.
Move erratically if you expect a Cannon Ball incoming.
Infesting a creep when you are in trouble is a great way to escape, especially if it is a catapult because it will grant you magic immunity.
You may want to save the best creeps you find to gank enemy heroes.
When Parasite is Infesting a creep, his hero dot will not appear on the mini-map. Be on the lookout for rogue creep dots on the mini-map that may be Parasite.
Parasite does high burst magic damage. Buy magic armor such as Mystic Vestments to help survive his burst damage.
A Portal Key is core in order to get in and out of battle! Activate Stalagmites, then Chuck, for maximum damage.
When in trouble, you can Chuck an enemy hero away from you to a farther enemy.
Buy magic armor to mitigate the powerful damage combo of Stalagmites and Chuck.
Don't let Pebbles walk up to you, or his Stalagmites, then Chuck combo will do it's maximum damage.
Use Impale to stun enemies, then use Flight to run away.
Buy a Portal Key to get in position for devastating Impale stuns on grouped enemies.
Buy armor to offset the negative effects of Swarm.
Spread out as Pestilence approaches to prevent multiple teammates from being stunned.
Use Wall of Mummies at a choke point, then attack one of the mummies to escape and block off assailants.
Use Tormented Soul to get vision of areas or to help kill an enemy across the map.
Avoid being caught in Wall of Mummies. A Tablet of Command can push you out without taking any damage.
When low in health, travel in unconventional paths to avoid being sniped by Tormented Soul.
Plague Carrier is best used in team fights and when enemies are close together so that it may bounce multiple times.
Remember to keep Cursed Shield on yourself and allies as often as possible to negate damage.
Once Plague Carrier is launched, immediately scatter from all nearby allies to mitigate its bouncing potential.
Avoid fighting Plague Rider away from allied creeps when he has Plague Carrier available.
Lining up Iconic Dash to hit an enemy hero will reset the cooldown, allowing you to immediately dash again.
Make sure to purchase items that increase your Max Mana as it will cause both Fulcrum Shift and Earthshatter to do more damage.
Killing Parallax causes him to lose Max Mana charges; try to focus him to help stop Earthshatter from doing massive damage.
Silencing Parallax while Earthshatter is active will stop it from doing damage for the duration of the silence.
You can trap an opponent, or yourself, in Voodoo Wards. Cast his disables before and after to delay and possibly kill them!
Try to use Tongue Tied after the enemy team has used it's disable spells or on the hero with the last unused disable in order to get a long-duration Tongue Tied.
If trapped in Voodoo Wards, don't panic! Attack them to carve a path out.
Stay close to an allied disabler to prevent long-duration Tongue Tied.

Predator's Carnivorous affords him a huge amount of life leech. Even if your health is low, activating Stone Hide and autoattacking will often keep you alive long enough for your allies to arrive, or may even net you a kill.
Items that give you speed or slow the enemy can help you stay on your target and leech life.
Predator lacks an interrupt. Carry a Homecoming Stone to easily escape. Buying additional armor will also help to mitigate the effects of Terror.
A Void Talisman can be an effective counter to a Predator attacking you.
Puppet Show is only effective if the target is standing near another unit.
Use Voodoo Puppet when an enemy is escaping so that you may attack the puppet instead of chasing after the enemy.
Puppet Show will only affect you if you are near another unit.
The only way to escape the Voodoo Puppet is to move out of its range.
Due to the large cast time of Dragonfire, you will need to lead your opponents in order to land the ability. Use all three of your abilities in unison on one target to deal massive damage.
Hitting at least one attack or spell every three seconds will keep stacking Burning on an enemy hero.
Pyromancer's stun, Dragonfire, has a long cast time. Try to guess where he may cast it and move to avoid it and the extra consequent damage he will inflict afterward.
Nullstone will prevent Pyromancer from casting Blazing Strike on you. He has no other single target spells to remove the Nullstone protection.
Activating Might of the Herd can slow nearby enemies, assisting an escape. When Horned Strike is off cooldown, attack them to push them away.
After hitting an enemy with Stampede, you can run to the other side to try and Horned Strike him back towards your team.
Buy armor to offset Rampage's powerful spike damage. Keep good map awareness to know when he's performing Stampede on you.
A Nullstone can prevent Rampage from charging you or using The Chains That Bind on you. A Tablet of Command can separate Rampage from his dragged target.
Always have at least one point in Essence Shroud so that you or an ally can escape from a bad situation when needed.
Defile can be cast on yourself or allies to amplify attacks by adding magic damage and a slow effect. Combined with the lowered magic armor from Mortification, Defile can unload serious damage.
Due to Essence Shroud, Revenant may escape and initiate from stealth. When fighting him, carry stealth detection so he cannot easily escape.
Mortification lowers your magic armor, picking up some extra magic armor from Mystic Vestments or going for Shrunken Head can help prevent this.
Make sure you are in a safe place when using Protective Melody, as you will be the only one on your team vulnerable in the area.
Use Disco Inferno when you want to stand and fight. It won't help you if you continue running.
You only take damage from Disco Inferno if you are standing still in it.
Disable or burst down Rhapsody when she uses Protective Melody because it will make the rest of her surrounding team nearly invulnerable.
Harrassing an enemy with your Watery Grave can quickly force your enemy out of the lane, leaving it free for you to farm!
Remember, whenever you are in water you move fast and can go invisible if no enemies are near you, making it a great tool for escaping when you have to.
When Riptide is on land she is very weak and can lose most encounters. Wait for her to use his ultimate and when its over go hunting for her!
Riptide gains strength against you while you are on water, avoid going toe to toe with her in the river, and remember you can always try to lose her in the jungle.
For 3 seconds after you move off of Desert's Curse sand trail, you retain the ability to move through any terrain; use this as an escape mechanism.
You can use Mirage and Manifest on a surprised enemy to escape from a gank.
Sand Wraith can teleport to any of his illusions his ultimate creates. Be ready for him to jump on you at any time.
Gank Sand Wraith early and often because he becomes very difficult to deal with later in the game.
A properly placed Unstable Shard can not only slow enemies, but block paths to ensure that they cannot get away from you, or advance toward you
Crystallize can be used not only to setup a teamfight, but also to reset a fight or gank that is not going in your favor.
Destroying the Unstable Shard or removing Sapphire's Quickshield can hinder her offense greatly.
Leaving an initiator outside of Sapphire's ultimate range can counter her attempts to setup a teamfight.
Use Electric Eyes to silence nearby enemies before escaping with Vanish. Always be mindful of whether enemies are carrying stealth detection.
Use Electric Eyes to keep vision on runes, counter Wards of Sight, or block creep spawns in the enemy team's neutral camps.
Buy stealth detection to avoid the Scout's flurry out of Vanish and destroy Electric Eyes before he can activate them. Seek him out and kill him early to prevent him from farming.
Vanish has a cooldown after coming out of stealth. You have a chance to burst down Scout when he comes out before he can Vanish again.
Send Shadow to explore an escape path, then switch positions with it if you are in trouble.
Tree Grapple's long range makes it excellent for escaping across cliffs.
Be careful when dealing with Silhouette's skill-shots, both the Tree Grapple and Death Lotus. To some extent you can see them coming and avoid them.
Keep track of Relentless Salvo stacks. Silhouette does more damage when she is able to sustain attacks on you.
Zoomerang can be used to gather morsels that are too dangerous to grab. Line it up to hit enemy heroes during this ability for extra harass.
Clear creep waves with Skrap's spells before Vorax gets to them to keep Vorax from slowing down during a push.
Vorax continues to gain health as long as Skrap feeds him morsels. Eliminating Skrap during pushes ensures Vorax doesn't grow too powerful.
Vorax is visible as soon as he spawns. Use this information to rally your team at the location you think will be in the most danger.
Use Toxin Wards defensively to scout incoming ganks. Poison Spray coupled with Poison Burst is often enough of a deterrent to force a retreat.
Buy items that will help you stay alive in a team fight and try to get Poison Burst and Toxicity on as many enemy heroes as possible.
Slither lacks an interrupt. Carry a Homecoming Stone if he poisons you to avoid death.
You should try to deny any teammate dying to Slither's damage over time abilities to prevent Slither from getting the gold and experience.
Try to cast your Judgment so that it hits enemies. Casting it as often as possible while escaping can allow you to turn the tide of battle.
You want to buy items that will allow you to stay alive long enough to get multiple Judgments off and have enough mana to use Demonic Execution if needed.
A Nullstone can nullify Soul Reaper's Demonic Execution. Magic armor will decrease the effectiveness of Soul Reaper's powerful spells.
Soul Reaper should be taken out early in a fight to keep him from using too many fight swinging Judgments.

Due to Soulstealer's ability to put out massive magic damage with Demon Hands by lining them up properly, he is able to turn the tides of battle when least expected. It is also important to remember that Soul Burst deals more damage the more souls you have and the closer you are to your enemies.
Use Demon Hands to clear groups creeps and regain souls after a death.
Soulstealer's Demon Hands are cast in an area in front of him, be sure to watch out for when he is facing you and move perpendicularly to avoid it.
When Soulstealer uses his ultimate, Soul Burst, it is best to get as far away from him as possible, as it does more damage the closer you are to him.
Use Mesmerize on targets who are not getting focused by your allies. Any ally who attacks the target will get the debuff put on them instead.
Make sure you are in a safe place when using Succubus' Hold to get a long duration hold.
It is best to approach Succubus with an ally so you do not get locked down by her channeling disable ultimate.
Right clicking your ally can swap Mesmerize onto yourself so your teammate can escape.
Use Blade Frenzy's magic immunity properties to your advantage. The duration is long enough to channel Homecoming Stone for a quick escape.
Try to catch enemies alone from allied units for an easy kill with Swift Slashes.
Swift Slashes does a huge amount of damage to individual targets, so stay close to allied units and heroes to distribute its power.
Blade Frenzy does a huge amount of magic damage if you are close to Swiftblade. Keep your distance from him or have a way to escape if he activates it.

Tempest can use Elemental to kill neutral creeps in the woods which typically keeps you out of harms way. Also the combination of Meteor and Elemental Void can turn the tides of any game if you catch the enemy team within it, but the enemy team knows this and will try to kill you first! Pick your times carefully of when to go in.
Buy a Portal Key to catch the enemy team grouped with a devastating Elemental Void. Be sure to catch enemy disablers in it or your ultimate won't last.
Tempest's stun, Glacial Blasts, will not trigger if he cannot see you, try to fog him!
Elemental Void is one of the most powerful ultimates in the game, but it is also channeling; make sure your team has a stun or disable ready to stop his channeling.
Thunderbringer's spells have very high cast ranges. Stay behind allies or trees to conceal yourself while dishing out damage.
Use Blast of Lighting and Lightning Storm to reveal stealthed units.
Be mindful of your health! When Lightning Storm is available, always retreat early.
Buy Magic Armor to mitigate Thunderbringer's spell damage.
Buy health so you can sustain yourself amidst a battle. Aim Chain Reaction slightly ahead of enemies to make up for the cast delay.
If you find yourself mana limited, save leveling Torment for later when you have a bigger mana pool.
Disabling Torturer will also stop Torment from being cast. Do not allow him to wedge himself between your team; he does the most damage when everyone is grouped closely.
Torturer does huge amounts of area of effect damage and should be taken out quickly.
Micromanage Boris to slow and immobilize your assailants while you run. Place Terror Mounds along the way to boost your speed.
Set Terror Mounds at base and in enemy territory to be able to quickly Terror Port to base or to gank.
Tremble lacks an interrupt. Carrying a Homecoming Stone can allow you to escape death.
Destroy Tremble's Terror Mounds whenever you can, but be careful of doing it alone as he can Terror Port to it and kill you.
Micromanage Coeurl to slow assailants while you escape. Use Avalanche to stun and slow them if necessary.
Be sure to cast Piercing Shards ahead where you expect the enemy to run because it has a travel time.
Kill Coeurl quickly to avoid being slowed. Buying a Nullstone can help prevent Tundra's powerful Avalanche stun.
Move perpendicularly to avoid Piercing Shards.
Save Courageous Leap for escaping. Use the stealth provided by Prism to escape in unpredictable fashion.
A Javalin of Light thrown from an unexpected angle has a much better chance of landing.
Valkyrie has very strong initiation tools. Avoid being ambushed by a Prismed team by purchasing stealth detection.
Keep on the move and keep your eyes peeled for Javelin of Light, as it can stun you up to five seconds based on how far it has traveled.
Time Final Chapter to disrupt enemy spells, especially channeling abilities.
Vindicator is very vulnerable alone, so stay behind allies to support and dish out damage.
Vindicator's damage output and utility are near unparalleled, but he moves slowly and generally has low health. Focus him first to take him out of the battle.
A Nullstone will protect you from a global Final Chapter.
Mojo heals you over time. Sometimes placing Mojo on yourself slightly early can end up keeping you alive in the long run.
Make sure you are in a safe place when using Spirit Ward in order to have it up for a long duration.
Cursed Ground is Voodoo Jester's primary source of damage, as it amplifies other damage sources. Avoid standing still or being stunned to dodge its long cast time.
Voodoo Jester can dish out a lot of physical damage by channeling Spirit Ward. Interrupt him quickly to avoid further damage!
Metamorphosis allows you to travel at maximum movement speed and ignore all slow effects. Buying and using a Shrunken Head during Metamorphosis will allow you to attack or escape with near impunity.
Micromanage Hellhounds to stack multiple neutral camps at the same time to increase your farming output.

Warbeast is most vulnerable early game when he is farming. During Metamorphosis, he is extremely fast and powerful, so the best option is to lock him down with crowd control or simply back off and wait out the duration.
Buying and using a Void Talisman can keep you alive during War Beast's Metamorphosis.
Bear Form gives Wildsoul a large amount of hit points and armor. Being in bear form will require a lot more resources to bring you down.
Micromanage Booboo to Return to you and attack heroes chasing you in hopes of Entagling Claws immobilizing them.
Focus on bringing down the main hero since this will also kill Wildsoul's bear Booboo. You may require the help of teammates since Booboo and Wildsoul together can take down most solo heroes.
Wildsoul is most vulnerable early game when he is farming. Hunt for him in the enemy neutral camps if you can't find him.
Miniaturization is cast instantly, making it a very powerful initiation and counter-initiation tool.
Power Drain is great for taking off Nullstone protection or against lanes without disables. It can also be used on creeps to replenish your mana.
Witch Slayer's Graveyard is extremely powerful when it hits more than one target. Try to stay far enough away from allies so both of you do not get hit.
Take out Witch Slayer early in team fights to keep him from using his multiple crowd control abilities on your team.
It is best not to use Flash of Darkness needlessly, as it is very important to use as an escape mechanism.
Try to save Bat Blast for when you can hit multiple enemies.
Clumping up as a team when facing Wretched Hag can be lethal because she may blink in at a moment's notice and deal large amounts of area of effect damage.
You want to disable and burst down Wretched Hag in order to kill her before she gets away with Flash of Darkness.
Consume your cyclones manually to heal yourself in order to keep you in the fight for longer.
It's good to drop Typhoon on top of enemies and then Gust them back in as they try to escape.
Zephyr does a lot of magic damage over time in an area around him, good counters are to stay out of the range of his cyclones or buy a Mystic Vestements.
Items such as Shieldbreaker and Hellflower are great ways to help kill enemy tank heroes such as Zephyr.
Build protective items because Strength Sap and Carnage will allow you to do plenty of damage if you can stay in the middle of a fight.
Mark for Death's cooldown resets whenever the target is killed. Be sure to cast it on your next target in the heat of battle.

Berzerker deals a lot of damage and gains resistance to stuns, debuffs, and disables while Carnage is active; however, he also takes increased damage for the duration. Be sure to focus him down quickly!
Berzerker deals only physical damage, even with his abilities, making high armor or Void Talisman important for surviving.
Blitz's main source of damage comes from maximizing Blitzkrieg. Casting a Lightning Shackles or Pilfering on the enemy or Quicking on yourself will greatly increase the damage done.
Quicken can be cast on yourself or allies to initiate or chase enemies down. Using it defensively can often be the difference between saving an ally or letting them down.
Blitz deals a high amount of burst damage however is very fragile. Strike first with a disable and you can shut him down before he gets any abilities off.
Quicken grants a significant movespeed burst, but does not provide any slow resistance. Stacking slows on a Quickened target will still cripple them to a crawl.
Ball Lightning deals a lot of damage and allows you to teleport to the enemy, but can be difficult to hit. Try using it when in melee range or waiting for an ally to disable the target.
Power Overwhelming will deal increasing damage throughout a fight, focus on survivability items like Helm of the Black Legion that allow you to keep on your target.
Ball Lightning is a very dangerous skill allowing Ravenor to teleport and stun you after it hits. The ability moves very slowly and only in a straight line, move aside when you see it!
Ravenor deals increasing damage with Power Overwhelming whenever he hits a target. Spread out to avoid him building up charges too quickly.
Artesia has an extremely short cooldown on her Arcane Missile but expends her mana very quickly. Be sure to pickup heavy mana items like Ring of Sorcery.
Essence Projection can be relocated after it's been placed, use this to maintain strong positioning throughout a fight.
Artesia deals a lot of long range magic damage but is also very fragile with no escape abilities. Initiate on her and she'll be dead before any of her damage goes out.
Essence Projection heals Artesia's allies in combat while also firing Arcane Missiles. Be sure to attack it down quickly whenever you see it.
Prophet's strength is in his team fight presence, amplifying the damage his enemies receive. Invigorate also heals for a small amount boosting attack speed and has a short cooldown.
Shared Fate can be used to slow enemies and propagate all of your spell effects and attacks. Be sure to place a Shared Fate before using your abilities.
Prophet's debuffs can be devastating, but last a short duration. Try to avoid being damaged while under the effect of Debilitate and Persecution.
Shared Fate will cause you and your allies to be affected by all of Prophet's abilities and attacks. Try to avoid staying in this zone unless Prophet's abilities are already on cooldown.
Rejuvenating growth can be used to help allies in other lanes if they are struggling or to strengthen their lane presence further.
Corrosive Pods cause allies to copy your casts of Spore Breath. You can use this to coordinate hero kills when they need a bit of extra help to take an enemy down.
Spore Breath stuns enemies at the end, but does not slow while dealing its damage. Try to disable Bramble and get away to avoid the stun.
Entangling Vine Wall deals large amounts of damage but has a short attack range. Try running outwards and avoid running alongside it.
Ellonia can deal significant damage throughout a fight, but expends alot of mana. Be sure to pick up heavy intelligence or mana items such as Ring of Sorcery.
Deep Freeze can deal devastating amounts of damage after building up stacks of frost. Try to use it as a finisher or lock enemies in place for your spells.
Ellonia deals a lot of damage and slow, but her abilities are easily dodged. Avoid standing still at all costs!
Frost does not last very long but will always refresh when hit by her abilities. If stacked up too high, try to outrange her and avoid fighting until it falls off.
Draconis can harass very well early game with Fiery Barrage. Be sure to put at least 1 point in this skill early on!
Draconis can use Cataclysm to engage in a teamfight where both teams have already committed. Enemies will burn faster from your damage this way!
Draconic Defense can be used to stall a push quickly and gives Draconis' team the upper hand. Use this when your enemies have already committed to a push and your team is ready to follow up!
Draconic Defense can also be used to fly back to your ally fountain to heal yourself quickly and take a lesser cooldown penalty to the skill. Keep this option in mind throughout the game!
Gunblade gains his survivability from his Demonic Shield. This scales with his agility allowing him to survive while receiving the damage benefits of Lethal Range.
Crippling Slugs and Grappling Shot both affect enemies through Magic Immunity.
Gunblade gains bonus damage for being close to you; try to keep your distance when attacking him.
Gunblade excels at killing a single target but is quite vulnerable to crowd control. Focus him down quickly if he tries to gain the benefits of his Lethal Range.
LRM can be cast from an extremely long range, allowing Artillery to deal damage from a safe distance. While channeling, you can retarget the skill by activating it again.
Mortar shot can slow enemies in a large area, more importantly the skill can be used while channeling LRM to land a few more shots.
LRM is a channeling ability. Look to disable or silence him when he's channeling. Be careful, though, because he can continuously change which direction he is firing.
Homing Missile can stun enemies for an extremely long duration but travels very slowly. Be sure to move away from your allies if you've been targetted by the missile!
Inherent Defense allows Kinesis to gain more survivability for doing damage. Look to hit as many enemies as possible with Mass Control.
Kinesis is entirely environment dependent. Try to avoid fighting in rivers where there is a lack of trees.
Stasis Smash will damage and stun nearby enemies once complete. Try to avoid being too close to allies who are in the air.
Telekinetic Control can deal a lot of damage to one target, however it has a pretty significant downtime. Engage him before his burst becomes available again.
Defiling Touch is free damage and slows on attack; just be sure to walk over a corpse to throw it.
Zombie Apocolypse deals high damage to random targets in the area; catching someone alone will maximize your chance for a kill.
Gravekeeper can use Corpse Explosion to deal large amounts of Magic Damage in the area. Avoid standing near dead creeps.
Zombie Apocolypse deals high damage to random targets in the area; try to engage Gravekeeper with allies or pet summons to distribute the damage.
Cascade Event combined with Wormhole can be a devastating initiation. Be aware of the cast time on each ability to time it correctly.
Riftburn deals increasing damage while enemies are standing in it. Cascade Event and Shared Existence can be used to keep enemies inside.
Wormhole deals a large amount of Magic Damage and stuns enemies in the area. Be sure to interupt her before her channel completes.
Riftburn deals increasing damage in the area. Try to avoid standing in the area for too long.
Lord Salforis gains a large amount of health from hitting enemies with Life Tap. Be sure to hit an enemy before the duration wears off.
Enemies that die under the effects of Undying will also grant you bonus damage. Don't forget to consume the soul for some extra hit points if necessary.
Dark Lord's Presence is a passive that deals damage around Salforis split evenly among all nearby targets. Try not to be caught standing near him for too long, especially alone.
The Undying deals a large amount of damage over time and stops all healing and regeneration effects on the target, but is still affected by magic armor and damage absorbing abilities.
Rally can use compel both defensively and offensively. Be sure to push you or your allies out of any dire situation!
Seismic Slam can deal a lot of damage but requires a short windup. Try saving it for when an enemy is disabled and immobile.
Rally's compel ability can be used to stun enemies, however the cooldown is very significant. Once his Compel ability is used, he makes for an easily focused target with no escape.
Rally's Seismic Slam can deal a lot of damage with one blow, but hits a small area in front of him and has a small windup. Be sure to interrupt him with disables if you see it casting.
Primal Surge can be used to restore a lot of life and mana over time, but won't save you if you're already low. Try to use it early in team fights and take advantage of its long duration.
Conflagrate will remain active and continue to drain mana even while disabled. Try to stay as close to enemies as possible.
While Primal Surge is active, Oogie will restore mana when damaged and restore life when spending mana. Try to avoid attacking him if he is low on mana, unless you can disable him for the kill.
Tar Quake has an extremely short cooldown, but costs an increasing amount of mana with every cast. Avoid running in normal patterns to dodge his nukes, then turn the fight when he is out of mana.
Solstice's ultimate can be cast from significant range, but has a long channel time. Try to hide in trees or cliffs out of sight of your enemy when channeling.
Solstice's Luminescence and Shadow Dash are invisible to the enemy, allowing you to stealth and stalk your prey ganking more effectively at night time.
Solstice will charge during the day time and stun his target and enemies around it, try to stay away from allies being charged and even interrupt the charge if able.
Solstice's ultimate has a significant channel time for its maximum effect. Interrupt her while she is channeling to cancel the effect entirely.
Preservation can stop all damage from enemies outside. Focus on using your abilities to keep enemies from getting in.
Soothing Presence restores more health over time the more allies are around you. Try to stay near your allies to maximize the effect.
Pearl's Preservation bubble only stops damage from the outside, rush inside the area to deal full damage!
Asphyxiate will dispel all buffs and slow on the initial cast, then repeat the effect in an area. Try to stay away from allies that are affected by Asphyxiate.
Shadow Step is a powerful setup tool however is difficult to land. Try sneaking up on your enemies when they're near trees or other heroes.
Illusory Assault lasts for a short duration but can deal alot of damage if the enemy is in short range. Use it on enemies closeby that are disabled or slowed to maximize the damage.
Grinex has a variety of invisibility tools at his disposal allowing him to initiate and escape very easily. Purchase items with true vision to track him down.
Shadow Step can push you into trees or other heroes dealing alot of damage and stunning. Try standing in the middle of the lane to deny him the opportunity.
Headsmash can deal alot of damage to the enemy but also to yourself. Try to avoid using it unless you have some charges of Lodestone Plates or Shatterstorm buildup activate.
Shatterstorm strips enemies of all armor and magic armor but also yourself. Rocket Drill can be used to escape the fight until your defenses return.
Lodestone Plates reduces damage from a limited number of sources. Try hitting him with low damage abilities to eat the shields rotating around him.
Shatterstorm deals alot of aoe damage and puts a devastating debuff on you. Try avoiding the hero while he is building up then engage him after he explodes.
Bushwack is very good at kiting enemies away, use Sidestep to dash away from enemies then slow them with a quick Crippling Dart.
Jungle Toxin deals more damage the more times you hit a single enemy. Try to focus on one target to stack the poison high.
Bushwack has alot of mobility and can kite enemies very well however has very low hit points. Hit him with a quick disable like Kuldra's Sheepstick to prevent his use of Side Step.
Spliter Shot deals damage to enemies behind Bushwack's target. Try to avoid standing in a line with your allies to avoid the extra splash damage.
Salomon gains a large amount of gold from killing creeps with his passive Wish For Wealth. To maximize this effect, be sure to clear a large number of creeps in a short period of time.
Salomon's Ultimate is both a great offensive and defensive tool granting access to all new abilities. Keep in mind that the health pool of your main hero is untouched while this form is active.
Cosmic Cleave hits a very wide area but is always a predetermined range. Rather than side stepping to dodge this skill, run directly forward or back.
Salomon is a threat to be wary of in his ultimate form. His form however has a very limited lifepool that can be destroyed very quickly. Be sure to focus him down to mitigate his damage output.
Ball and Chain is easier to hit the further away enemies are. Try to avoid using your hook on enemies in close range unless they are disabled.
Prison Break can hit multiple enemies but also has a significant delay. Don't be too greedy trying to hit multiple enemies or you risk hitting none.
Shackled prevents the use of movement abilities but can be attacked by you or your allies. Destroy it quickly to save your teamates from the slow and damage.
Prison Break requires Prisoner to be in range for 3 seconds to achieve his stun. When active, spread out in different directions of the Prisoner to deny him multiple triggers on your team.
Lance-A-Long can deal a large amount of damage at full potential but can also be activated for half damage if you need some quick burst for a finishing blow.
Knightfall is an amazing initiation tool but can also be used defensively. Don't forget to activate your ult when in danger to survive for a few more seconds.
Joust allows Benzington to charge in a line at considerable distances, the ability however has a considerable wind up, try to sidestep to dodge it.
Knightfall can deal alot of damage in a big area, but will also follow the target he chooses. Try to avoid clumping up from the target declared by Benzington.
Doppelgangers have a low mana cost and cooldown. Use them to scout ahead safely or build up an army prior to a fight.
Deceive can be used as both a ganking or escape skill. Take advantage of the invisibility time to setup a good position for your Twisted Visage.
Doppelgangers add alot of damage to a team fight however they are very vulnerable when attacked.
Twisted Visage has a notable link and channel time before Circe can clone the enemy. This can be disrupted by moving out of range or by interrupting Circe.
Fireflies can be used to setup ganks with Rolling Thunder, but are just as useful for scouting enemies in fog when you are on the defensive.
Allies are invulnerable while inside Rolling Thunder. Rolling at just the right time can save a teammate's life and potentially turn the fight!
Rolling Thunder will follow the target Shellshock chooses, but can be outrun to place him and his allies in a vulnerable position for counter-initiation.
Sanctuary Stone can be picked up by his allies after Shellshock's death. Destroy it before this happens to remove any Magic Armor advantage for the opponents!
Sacred Totems last for 30 seconds when placed. If you think there is danger nearby, it doesn't hurt to drop them at your feet to setup your defenses ahead of time.
Spirit Walk is a great initiation tool, but it can also be used for the auxiliary effects of disjointing enemy projectiles or gaining 50% damage reduction while channeling.
Warchief's ultimate; Warcry is an enormously powerful team buff. It is however just a buff, and may be purged to immediately end the effect for him and his team.
Warchief's Sacred Totems die in one hit. The Shock Totem can often be killed before it activates and killing the Life Totem early can deny Warchief a good deal of health.
